meanings.definition: The process of cell division in which the chromosomes are not duplicated.
meanings.sent1: During haplosis, the cell divides without doubling its chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study haplosis to understand how cells reproduce.
meanings.sent3: The biology students found haplosis fascinating because it was like a genetic magic trick.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, haplosis is like a solo dance performance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful diagrams to explain haplosis to the class.

meanings.definition: The state of being haploid, having a single set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: Haplosis results in cells with only one set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: The haplosis of certain organisms allows for genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The haplosis of the organism made it unique among its species.
meanings.sent4: In a world of pairs, haplosis stands out like a lone wolf.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of haplosis makes it easier to understand genetic concepts.
